text: I had high expectations for this place and when I called them late last night to ask if they had any patties I was told "many patties". I got there after 9pm and ordered 2 chicken and two beef patties plus jerk chicken with white rice and cabbage. The jerk was flavorful but a bit too salty for my taste, although the chicken was tender, falling off the bone, I feel it was a bit too salty and the white rice was ok, not dry which was good. Now, when it comes to patties, I go for texture and taste of the meat. First I had the chicken which had spice but the crust of the patty to me wasn't all that great, a bit soggy which I think they put them in the microwave, to me that's a no-no with Jamaican patties. Patties to me are supposed to be flaky and the meat should have good spices. Both patties were ok, not all that thrilling. The place was clean and empty, the employees were friendly but both were in the kitchen area leaving the front desk empty, I had to raise my voice to have someone help me in the front. So it's not Ocean Blue Caribbean restaurant where I felt right at home.

I love it!   Yummy!!!!!   If you want some authentic amazing Guyanese and caribbean food, look no further!  The chicken roti is awesome!!!   The jerk chicken is amazing also!  I have been there many times and have loved it every time!  Wish they had dhal puri on their menu.  It's not fancy by any means, but it's  authentic Guyanese food!

The smell of jerk spices drew us into this place, and it was pretty good but not great.  The meat is beyond compare- savory, flavorful and satisfying.  The sides are a little disappointing- the plantains are delicious, but the rice and vegetables I had weren't that great. The service was OK.  We all agreed that it wasn't as good as we hoped but that we felt it deserved another chance.  One note: we tried to redeem a Restaurant.com certificate and the owner said they had stopped accepting them months ago.  She said she had asked Restaurant.com to take the offer down, and she refused to accept the certificate.  I called Restaurant.com and asked for a refund, and they would only let me exchange it for another restaurant.   I continued to check for a week or two afterwards and the offer remained up.  That was a few months ago, and looking at the website now, they still have the offer, but in a smaller amount.  If you are thinking of purchasing a Restaurant.com certificate for this restaurant, you may want to call them first and make sure they still accept it.

FINALLY! A great AUTHENTIC Caribbean restaurant! Chef Patrick is awesome! Curry chicken is to DIE FOR, so tender and the gravy is awesome. Jerk chicken was very good as well, asked for more spice on the side because WHEW can they make it spicey!   Don't forget the rice and beans!!  Seriously! It's worth a try!

great service.  super friendly staff.  gave us tons of free samples and talked to us for a while.  food is excellent.  decor is lacking, but eat with your mouth, not your eyes.  would recommend the ox tails, plantains, and curry.

So, I went back again last night and ordered the jerk chicken and asked that it be very spicy, like it normally is supposed to be, and they did it! I was imrpressed  The flavors on my plate were amazing.  The cabbage, plantains, beans and rice, and jerk chicken were all worth the $9.50 plus tax.   I am thinking of having an East Coast foodies event there.  Good job with the spice this time A Taste of the Caribbean.  Cheers

The food is fantastic and the service is incredible. The people here made me feel like I was having a meal in their home as they prepared everything wonderfully, adding extras at no charge just because it would add to the flavor and experience.   I highly recommend trying the jerk chicken and any of the curry dishes.

Throughly disappointed my fish was dry and not good and it was tilapia which is not a Jamaican fish, the chicken wings were dry and cold, and the ox tail stew had one ok piece and two SMALL pebble size pieces for $14. When the sides are the best thing you have to offer, you're  in trouble. Totally not worth the time and more importantly the money. I WANT MY MONEY BACK!!!

The 5-Star rating is a combo good food+cool place - wish Tempe could support more unique restaurants like this one!    Had both the Oxtail (excellent) and the Jerk Chicken (really good) - the plantains are a special treat (could hear them sizzling in the kitchen).  I'm into heat - but don't expect (or be concerned by) a lot out of their jerk sauce - it's a Guyana jerk style which is considerably milder than Jamaican version.
Nasty nasty nasty food, don't know why they call it roti, it's more like bread, the jerk chicken  was burnt and hard,serving left over rice OMG I had diarrhea, nasty  nasty food

Well I'm happy I finally found a decent Caribbean spot in the valley.  When you're craving some roti/buss up shut it's a good place to go if you're not in he mood to make it yourself. The service is kind of slow so  if  you are on lunch, might not be the best place.... but the great thing is it's real cooked food!

Got the jerk chicken, and was immediately surprised by its rave reviews. don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. the chicken texture was dry at best, and crumbled in your mouth at worst, depending on the piece. rice tastes like it looks in the pictures. cabbage was okay. i didn't get plantains. i wouldn't be back unless a friend dragged me back, even though i live super close. there are enough other, more cost efficient mediocre food places i'd rather go

First time here AND first time trying authentic Caribbean! Delicious!! The Jerk chicken (delicious!!), boiled veggie side (complimented the dish!), and the rice/bean duo (hearty) was absolutely divine! I will definitely be returning! Sam is funny and is clearly an awesome cook! Thanks for the hospitality Sam! :)   Side note: Do not be alarmed by the absence of a 'dinner rush' as I personally despise having to wait in long lines for food anyway. They were personable and I acquired my food quicker than expected ;)

Came here for the first time Thursday then second on Friday and had the curry chicken. The first time the cabbage was nasty the second time it was much better had a nice flavor. The first night I ordered a small and I told the guy working the counter it wasn't enough and he gave me more chicken which I appreciated. The chicken and rice was really good they could kick up the spice a little. The second time I went my chicken had lots of bones and less meat so that was disappointing.

After looking for a place to satisfy my taste for an authentic beef patty...this place is just average.   Being from NY and eating freshly prepared beef patties, I am admittedly a snob.  These patties from this Tempe based restaurant reminded me of the Tower Isle frozen brand.  The dough was extra thick, dry and tough to swallow.   However after peeling off several dough layers, I was able to salvage the rest and be reintroduced to the very tasty spicy beef filling.  I also had the jerk chicken platter.  The chicken legs were very good however the thigh was a little dry.  The accompanying fried plantains were very good and a sweet delight.  The red beans and rice was also very good.  Overall average food at an average price

Hidden gem! If youre adventurous and into exotic comfort food, this is the place for you. Such an unexpected surprise! Take a foodie friend here and enjoy some down home island love. Your heart will sing!

This place is so good. We got the ox tail stew and jerk chicken. Both were amazing. The people that work there are very nice and helpful. Jus ask them if you have any questions. There isn't much 'ambiance', but really, who cares, the food is amazing.  Definetely check this place out.

I was really excited to try this restaurant, and tonight my husband and I came and ordered food to take-out. The service was very friendly and the store was clean, cute, and colorful...but the food was very disappointing. My husband ordered the curry chicken, and although it tasted okay, he literally almost choked on tiny bones in the meat 4 or 5 times. I asked ahead of time if they used white meat and was told yes, but the "Calypso Pasta" I ordered had tiny, tiny pieces of dark meat jerk chicken...instead of the boneless white strips I was expecting, and really it was just mediocre. I'm bummed I wanted to like this place.

I come here all the time to eat and almost every single time i do i pay $15-20 for food that isnt even enough! I order oxtails i get mostly bones and have to complain! Today i get a small curry chicken and it was only 4 small pieces of meat and more cabbage and juice than anything! This was the last straw for me you all will never get my business again!

BOMB! AUTHENTIC! THE REAL DEAL!   If you're looking for a quick cheap trip to the Caribbean, there is NO WHERE better then this place! TRUST ME, I lived there! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place! YOU gotta go!

We went to this restaurant the day before Mother's Day as My Mum Loves Caribean food & this was a new place to try out. The pictures on yelp looked good. I had planned what I wanted well ahead. However when we tried to call in with our order, reading on Yelp how the food goes out fast, we only got the answering service. So we got there anyway. Looked an ok place with a few people around, more seated & waiting for their take away. We ordered the Rotti & they were out of it. Ordered the Jerk chicken, Jerk Fish & the Ox tail stew  a Mango smoothie. We were there about 20 mins until our food was served. We got no water or even the drink ordered. The food arrived, The jerk chicken was not at all spicy. The Fish was with a brown sauce, Onions & Baby tomatoes & sweet as ever. The Ox tail was sweet too. No Plantains or salad.When I asked about it, the server disappeared & never came back,  Still no water or Drink. Then I asked the server if it was jerk fish & showed him the picture on Yelp of the jerk fish I saw & wanted. He then said he was not the one who cooked it & will ask the lady to talk to me. The lady came out after about 10 mins & when I asked her, she said, It was brown stew & she was sorry & wouldn't charge for it. Didn't help as I was not happy with my food. Still not water or Drink. I then asked for some hot sauce to add to m sweet meal. We just finished a part of it & walked up to pay. I then see the smoothie being blended. I had to tell the lady, I didn't want it any more as I was done. We had to walk up to the counter 2 times, just to ask for water. Working there was the Lady cooking, a server who could hardly be heard & a Girl who was at the cashier, but never smiled or even moved to get anything for anyone. The Lady then said she was all stressed out, as she had no sleep & had to do all the cooking & the server was embarrassed to come out much as he couldn't speak English. Really not my concern. if there were so many issues, it would have been better to close for that night. One thing I would say is, I will never, Ever go there again & I will not advice anyone else to go there either. If you read this review & want to take my advice, do not go to this place. I am sure there are much better places to go to.

I love this place!    Finally had a chance to revisit after a long, unwarranted absence.  Apparently, they are in the process of changing their name to "Caribbean Spice".  In addition to the name change, they have appeared to have slimmed down the menu.  Of course, all the standards are still available (jerk chicken, curry chicken/goat, roti, etc) but other items have been relegated to "special order" status (such as salt fish), which means you just have to pre-order these items.  Had the curry chicken on this visit.  Yes, it's still yummy!  Was talking to the elderly woman and mentioned how much I loved pepperpot.  It wasn't listed as an available item for the day, but she mentioned she had some in the back.  Oh my word!  She went back and brought me a nice sized bowl of it.... COMPLIMENTARY! Gotta love this place!!!  I'm telling you.. that pepperpot is my crack!  LOL  Don't forget to ask for the "pepper sauce" for those of you who like hot sauce.  My Grandmom used to make that potent pepper sauce and this place does not disappoint.  Eating here takes me back to my childhood and all the great Guyanese dishes to which I was privy.

I've never tried Caribbean food but live nearby and drive by this restaurant all the time.  It is definitely no frills, very mom and pop feel.  I had the curry chicken (small size), I should have ordered a larger portion.  Aside from not having a soda/drink machine I liked the organic vibe to it, the large painted map of the Caribbean basin/sea was a nice touch.

Very small, colorful restaurant. Ordered the jerk chicken and goat curry. Jerk chicken was spectacular. Was easy to eat and perfectly cooked. It was served with a generous portion of beans, rice and a grilled banana. Goat curry wasn't my favorite, but I've never liked goat. Definitely try this place! The women are very sweet! Plus, they sell jewelry :)

I just got back from my second trip to A Taste of the Caribbean, and decided I had to Yelp. I lucked into it by accident last weekend when we got to U.S. Egg a little too late to be seated. I had the Bakes and Black Beans last time and really, really loved them. The spices in the black beans were unlike anything I'd ever experienced. My partner had the Jerk Chicken and pronounced it fantastic.   Today, I had the oxtail, which has been so widely praised here. The reviews are right; the braised oxtail are amazing. The cabbage with mine was perfectly boiled, tender but not soggy, and the plantains were just as richly sweet, starchy, and crispy this time as they were last time.   The atmosphere is great, though I do worry that they won't have enough seating if business really picks up. This is a comfortable, relaxed place to have lunch, and sit and talk for awhile. This is not for quick eat-and-go; if you don't want to stay for an hour or so, get your food to go. I chatted with the owner for awhile before we ordered and she was wonderful, pleasant, and welcoming.   Anyway, I just can't recommend it enough. Go there and get some good food and chill out. Get the bakes!

Cute little place right off of Baseline about a mile or two down from the Arizona Mills mall. The owners/servers were very kind and helpful and playfully giggling at me as I was trying to figure out what to order. This was my first time EVER having Caribbean food. I was a little apprehensive but my friend assured me I would enjoy it.   I ordered the Jerk Chicken dinner meal. It took about 1/2 an hour for my meal to arrive; it was WORTH the wait. They cook everything to order so it DOES take some time to prepare; just be patient. Anyhow, this "Jerk" chicken was absolutely delicious!!! I was pleasantly surprised!! And I do NOT like dark meat chicken or spicy food but whatever they did to this cancelled all of that out!! My lips and face were on fire afterwards but dang...it was SO worth it!!! The other stuff with this chicken was so dang good I wanted more. It came with some sort of rice with beans in it, some sort of cole slaw type of vegetable salad, and...the best part...PLANTAINS. I have never had plantains until today and I left wanting to take an entire ORDER home with me. They taste like bananas but with a different kind of flare. DEeeeeellliccccioussss!!!!   I have a feeling everything they cook is delicious. I will definitely be back the next time I am in Tempe/Phoenix.

We had their oxtail stew, jerk chicken, and curry chicken. Oxtail was average but tasty, jerk was dry (got it at the end of the night) and the curry chicken was VERY moist and perfect. Their plantains were the best I've ever had. She makes hers with a sugar glaze. VERY sweet.

I walk in and go up to the counter, immediately stoked about the bottles of jerk sauce and yummy oddball sodas...  We ordered fried plantains, jerk fish and curry veggie something... the food is very yummy! But god damn we waited a fucking hour!!!! It was insane. And yes, that means the food's fresh or whatever, but dude... an HOUR. They should warn people before they order.   Anyways, the point is that the service was really bad (and I've been there multiple times and the service has sucked every time), but the deliciousness of the food made up for it. Considering the fact that it's a family joint I'd go back, but if this was a chain, they'd never see me again.   My favorite part about this place is the HORRIBLY drawn map of the Caribbean islands on the wall and patio furniture in the dining room : )

I made the mistake of using an online delivery thru Tempetakeout.com...  I wasn't notified that items weren't available, and the drink was just missing.  BUT... when I notified the restaurant the owner delivered my missing item & supplied extra to make up for what the delivery service left out!!    FOOD IS AMAZING and you just cant beat their customer service!!   Thank you again for the great food and making it right even thought it was Tempe Takeouts issue!   You rock!
This place is awesome! Strongly suggest the chicken curry with roti! By far one of the best dishes I've ever had! Cool little place with great food. Try it out you won't be disappointed!

If you're in the mood for a foodie adventure, I've got just the thing. A trip to the Caribbean! Head on over to Tempe and enter A Taste of the Caribbean restaurant. The bright yellow and green walls, red floor and outdoor furniture will make you feel like you've arrived. It's kind of scruffy and laid back - this is not the place to come for a quick bite. First of all, you have to make the tough decision about what to order. Oxtails or goat? Jerk chicken, of course, or do you want the milder brown stew chicken? Fish? There's snapper, tilapia, and shrimp. The menu is divided up into Caribbean Favorites, Friday and Saturday Menu, Lunch Specials, Rice Bowl Specials and Plate Specials. If all this has your head spinning, you're not alone. Our server, part of the family who own and run the place, seemed equally confused. But she was charming. Just accept it, and the slow service as part of the experience - don't worry, be happy.       We ordered oxtails ($11.95) and Eggplant Curry Shrimp ($9.95). The oxtails, in a brown sauce, were fall-off-the-bone tender, fatty, as oxtails are, and totally delicious. The accompanying plantains were caramelized and a little crunchy. Perfection. A huge mound of rice and peas filled the center of the plate - moist and beautifully seasoned. And finally, a side of cabbage. There must have been a little sugar in the cooking pan, because it was sinfully delicious. Served on the side was a basket of roti, a homemade flatbread, similar to a flour tortilla but much softer. It was so hot we burned our fingers trying to pull off a piece. We had finished off the oxtails when the eggplant dish arrived (they were supposed to have come out together - it's a good thing we like to share). Be forewarned, this curry is not for the faint-of-mouth. I wasn't expecting the degree of heat - my nose started running and my eyes watered. But it was pure bliss, with flavor layered on flavor. The shrimp were perfectly cooked, although I wouldn't have minded a few more, and the eggplant was so tender it was almost melting into the gravy. There were also some pieces of potato, which had not been mentioned on the menu, hiding in there. The heap of rice and peas helped mitigate some of the heat. As you might have gathered, between the roti, the plantains, the rice and peas,and the potatoes, this is a carb-lovers paradise.       Two odd things: a wide variety of Caribbean sodas are sold here, but no ice tea. And the rest rooms are in a different building than the restaurant.       The only disappointment was dessert. I got a pineapple tart to take home (I couldn't have eaten another carb if my life depended on it). Our server had said it was the best of the two desserts available. Uh-oh. The tart was really bad - a smidgen of decent pineapple filling wedged between layers of leaden dough, tough and greasy. I was glad I hadn't eaten it at the restaurant, because it would have put a bad ending onto an otherwise extraordinary meal.

So, I had The Jerk Chicken, Rice and Peas With Plantains And Cabbage. The Rice and Peas were the best thing about this place everything was was not good at all.  The Jerk Chicken had no flavor no heat at all and if you had Jerk Chicken you know it should be spicy. I had better places. This as my second time here I forgot the reason why I didn't go back now I know. Will not go back again

Growing up in the caribbean, I soooo wanted to like this place.  Really, I wanted to.  They are guyanese, which is one of my favorite caribbean versions; I grew up with many guyanese friends and know the flavor profile well.   We stopped in for lunch - place was empty.  Perhaps a dinner might be better; I got the sense that they were still prepping for the evening, so lunch is whatever they have on hand.  They were out of curried goat.  They didn't have enough of the oxtail to make up my meal, so they gave me what they had and added some stewed chicken.  The beef patties were commercially bought ones - very disappointing.  I'd hoped they made their own here. Overall, flavors were average.  The sparse caribbean restaurant options in Phoenix gives this place a pass on the flavors - it's better than not having any, but nothing to write home about (at least not the lunch I had). The owners are friendly, and the place is relatively clean (tables a bit sticky, however).   I really want to like them, so I'll give them another try - this time a dinner when I'm in the neighborhood.  Perhaps go with the more traditional roti and curry goat.... IF it's available!  Reserving judgement for now.....
The jerk chicken was very flavorful and delicious but we weren't able to get all the sides that were included with the dish because they stop making certain sides two hours before closing.

Awesome vegan options including faux jerk and curry chicken, as well as tofu and veggie options for their jerk, curry, and roti dishes.   Servers are always nice and patient and prices are fair. This place is really a must for vegans and vegetarians.
Wow! This place is wonderful!!! Very good home cooked Jamaican dishes... The service was great! Love, love love it!! We will be back

the food is good, maybe even great.  I got the goat curry and it was delicious, the meat was tender and the curry was a delicious blend of flavor and spice.  The place itself is pretty run-down, no bathrooms, paint peeling off the walls.  But to me, that's always a good sign because it usually means the food is authentic.    My complaint with the place is that if you're going to pay close to $15 for curry, you shouldn't leave still hungry unless you eat like a mouse.  Not the most money-efficient place to go if you're a big eater.

I really wanted to like this place but my experience was rocky right from the start. I called in an order for dinner and when I said the last item, the phone hung up. I called back and he said, "I thought you were finished". I said well, I thought you would have told me the price, when it would be ready, take my name or least thank you/good bye. Dead silence. Ok, strike one.  When I go pick up the food, I knew it was the same person on the phone because of lack of customer service skills. I can overlook poor customer service if you're food is on point. However, this was not the case so Strike two.  The food was not the worse and not the best...just mediocre. The best part was the peas and rice...good flavor, just needed some salt and was not dry. I had the Brown Stew Chicken which was disappointing. The chicken pieces were small (literally) however, I anticipated that, which is why I ordered a large. What I received was a thigh cut in half and a leg-thigh quarter. The chicken was cooked ok; not moist but not dry either but the seasoning was lacking. You get a side of cabbage which was ok. I love plantains and there's was cooked perfect. I also had a Meat Patty which had a dry tasteless pastry crust but the filling was yummy. Strike three and unfortunately I don't think I will be going back but I still think the restaurant deserves no less than three stars.

This place is a must visit for my friends and I when we visit  from California. It's just like eating grandma's house good food, chill atmosphere, definitely not some trendy place.   We usually order goat curry, jerk fish, ox tail stew, and lots of plantains. We tried their plain roti and the owner saw that we were eating it plain and gave us some chicken curry to eat with it. As always, service is just like at grandma's.  We called ahead to order our food so we didn't have to wait long to get our food. It worked out great and our food came pretty fast.   I also tried their beta juice. It was good and made fresh.

Fall off the bone perfect flavored jerk chicken. Off the beaten path a bit, decor is nothing special, but the food is a 10!! The little jamaican ladies always come out and ask how the food is. So nice that they ask.  They do take their time getting your food out, but anyone that has been to the carribean knows....well thats just how it is. Always worth the wait. I'll be back time and time again!

This was my first experience with Caribbean food and I was not disappointed.  I had jerk chicken with beans and rice and cabbage.  The chicken had a lovely afterburn. My husband had the brown stew chicken which was very mild. The only down side were the bones my husband and I had to watch out for so we didn't swallow them.
Omg!!! The food was outstanding!!. A small but charming place... I recommend it!!!! My best meal on this trip...
The food was awesome! Great food- service was great too but it did take a long time so be prepared to wait a while. Otherwise it was better than expected food and I grew up with this food.

I was in the Tempe area visiting friends.  We had been to several restaurants that were decent, but nothing special.  i was sort of tired of "New Americana" (this style restaurant seems to be in abundance in this area).  My boyfriend and i wanted something different and good so we turned to Yelp for some advice.  As soon as I walked in, I knew it was going to be good.  There were maybe 5 tables and the atmosphere was super laid back.  There are only a few different meals on the menu, but you can get each dish with a variety of meat (or order it vegetarian).    Looking at the decor, I  felt like I was in my grandmother's home in the Dominican Republic.  The staff is really nice and the food was so fresh.  Our meals came with plantains and I could immediately smell the sweetness of the plantains coming from the kitchen.  If I'm ever in the area, I will definitely stop by again!
My favorite is veggie roti, my daughter's is shrimp roti. I travel 3o min to eat here 2x per month.

I had heard good reviews and decided to visit last night for dinner.  As other reviews have stated, the service is not super quick.  But it kind of worked with the island theme.  When the food was brought out, the proportions were generous (I had to get a to go box) but my friend ate all that was on his plate.  I had the 'sing a melody' and he had the oxtail.   I would recommend this place, but only if you have some time to spend (not on a rushed lunch break!)

Came here on a Tuesday night for a birthday dinner with some friends. We had the entire place to ourselves. The waitress was friendly and let us move the tables together. They didn't charge us automatic gratuity or complain about seperate checks.  ToC gets points for serving filtered water. I appreciate that so much, and no need for lemon wedges to mask the taste of AZ tap water.   The server was friendly and attentive and kept our waters full and answered all our questions. She even let my friend sample the oxtails before ordering.Took a little while for the food to come out, but I am used to that at places like this.  All the dishes looked amazing and smelled mouthwatering good! I ordered the curry chicken with an extra side of plantain (i'm part naija and thus a plantain addict) and roti-which is a kind of flatbread. My chicken came with rice and black beans, a few plantain and tender, well seasoned cabbage, all excellent. The chicken was fall off the bone good, flavorful with just the right amount of heat and just plain tasty! The roti was a hot basket of a big folded tortilla-like bread. Really good for soaking up the sauce on my plate. Eveyone was pleased with their food, I could tell because their was a nice lull in the conversation! We relaxed and ate until we couldn't anymore. After we were done eating, the owner, Paula, came and checked on us and thanked us for coming in. She was very nice and I hope that ToC sticks around. I need this kind of food nearby.  ToC is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and serves their breakfast items all day, which is a bonus to me.  They also serve a variety of vegetarian dishes which look good to an omnivore such as myself. For more timid folks, there are pasta, salads and quesedilla on the menu too. They also do takeout, and quite a few people came in for to-go orders while we were there. The space is small and cute, with bright gold walls and a mural, there is a small love seat to wait on.  I could easily see eating here once a week, lol, as I love good Jamaican style food. I already have added the oxtails, jerk, brown stew and green banana dishes on my list of must try items. As well as the patties, which the server said run out by noon. They are made by hand everyday and I can't wait to try them.

i was a bit nervous to my first visit. We were the only people in the restaurant.  Usually that is a very very bad sign.  However, the food was FANTASTIC.  I had the Jerk Tofu, which came with Beans & Rice, a cabbage concoction, and fried Plantains.  Everything was great!  I am not sure why the place was empty during lunch time, but I will definitely be going back!!!

I came here for the 1st time a few days ago. The food was down right EXCELLENT. Full of flavor. I had the Jerk Mango Wings & Brownrice Chicken Stew. Although the food was terrific it was over shadowed by the poor and inconsistent service. The waitress/hostess completely forgot about our table we waited about an hour to eat and the food did not come out all at time. And when we did get our food the order was incorrect . So, the food is great but id suggests ordering togo or your sit down experience will be disappointing.
Love this place! Friendly staff, great food, and cool art. I loved the jerk chicken. My only complaint is the furniture is pretty uncomfortable.

Jerk-style caribbean fare, and very tasty. It's a family style resturant with the complete home cooked atmosphere. Be warned that the food preparation takes a little while but the service is very good and friendly.   *does not serve coke, but has some caribbean imports.
Have come here few months ago. I came with my family. The food is great and the service is good too. This place is a worth place for me to come. Gonna come again !!!

You know when you get a huge plate of delicious looking food and all your dining companions comment that in no way could you ever finish all that food? A Taste of the Caribbean is like that. Only the food is just that good that you WILL finish your gigantor plate of grub!  They have only a few drink options (your typical Coke products, some tea and juice options).  The spot is super cute and bright, and reminded me of some of the hole in the wall joints I've visited on my Central American and Caribbean travels. I don't know about you, but brightly colored walls just make me happy!  My only complaint was some super Evangelical TV show was on. Sure, we probably could've asked for it to be turned off or volume down, but I didn't want to offend the adorable cook, "Mama."  Will I be back?  Heck yes!

As the others have mentioned, the decor and service are a bit lacking, we have to agree. The Nanny was on TV when we ate here last Friday night. At 7:30pm we were the only table. We counted no fewer than 7 employees (including children who helped serve us).  I started with a ginger beer. I didn't know what it was before I ordered, but it was so strong I couldn't drink it. The (head?) waitress later asked if it was too strong and I said yes. She brought a to-go cup and told me to put half ginger beer and half water together at home.  I had the goat curry. It was amazing. Super tender and flavorful; just watch for the tiny bones. The oxtail was sold out. Hubby had the jerk chicken which was moist with a bit of a kick.   Sides were rice, a warm cabbage slaw, and plantains. Overall, we thought the food was excellent for the price, but it's really not a great date place.
Decent Caribbean style fare. Get the oxtail and jerk chicken and you shouldn't be disappointed.

Tried for the first time with my omni boyfriend because they offered vegan food for me yay! I really appreciate that. I got the 'vegan jerk' and wasn't sure what to expect. This dish is soo spicy! It is delish, as expected vegan food is more expensive so my dish had less "meat" for the higher price but worth it.

Came here for takeout.  I was feent out (yes, I said feent out) for some Caribbean food (other than my own).  And the Caribbean restaurants are few and far between out here.  On top of that, I'm a veggie.  So I was excited when I learned of a spot that touts healthy Caribbean food.  As a Caribbean girl, I wanted to love this place, but... CONS: Curry Tofu was not as firm as I like, spicy but lacking seasoning to balance it out, only 3 slivers of plantain. PROS: Large serving sizes, clean, homey, friendly hosts, late hours, Caribbean map drawn on the wall :)  I will definitely give them another shot, as I know many people don't know how to cook tofu properly.  Since they are Guyanese, I'll give the vegetable roti a try next time.

I eat here when I need my oxtail fix, most places smother they're oxtail in gravy but not here. They have a nice sauce that they braise the oxtails in & it comes out so tender and flavorful. Today I also tried the jerk chicken & that was awesome as well. I recommend this place!

If you're a Caribbean food lover, jerk or stewed chicken in particular, then you know how hard it is to find really good Jamaican food in AZ.  Sadly, it's really, really hard.  Occasionally I have a serious craving for it and on this particular night I just had to have it.  I stopped in for an order of Jerk Chicken and cocoa bread.  For starters they do not serve cocoa bread - bummer!  I ordered a small order of jerk chicken for almost $9 bucks.  It was such a small portion, served in a side dish to-go container.  I was too nervous of not liking the jerk chicken so I decided on a small size.    I've never really heard bad reviews of this place, never heard good ones either.  The only think I heard was the portions were small.  Indeed they are.  The small portion was a half - HALF of a piece of a thigh.  I received the portion that had more bone on it than meat and what looks like a fuller part of the drum stick.  Maybe it was a piece of the thigh, it was hard to tell.  I also felt like the jerk chicken had more of a BBQ chicken taste - not my favorite. I haven't had a chicken roti in 4 years (since living in Arizona) so I must go back and try that.  Maybe I'll be able to update my review and star rating.  Maybe?!

Amazing food. Our first time there was 10/6/10. Being a native of the Carribean, I grew up eating curry chicken, stew goat, rice & beans, ox tails, saltfish and everything in between. My parents were great cooks, and this place truly reminded me of home and my parents cooking. I was not disappointed by the meal I ordered. I ate the curry chicken and my fiancee ate the jerk chicken. For under $20, we both left there full, and fat, with  huge smiles on our face from the great food. I would definitely recommend this place to any fellow islanders looking for a taste of home, and to anyone else wanting to try something new. No they don't have Maubi.

I saw the reviews and I felt that this was a place that I needed to try out. I do like myself some good jerked chicken from time, to time - I mean who doesn't? But it is clear that I didn't read the reviews well enough, or they left a few things out, and I will try to rectify this.   - I expected more of a restaurant than a diner, with the simplicity of a Mexican lunch place. This is not necessarily a bad thing, just unexpected. The price does reflect the minimalistic decor and the very spartan wooing attempt.   - Taking the chance of sounding like a pretentious ass, I ordered water and thought I'd get a water bottle and charged for such - but instead I got a cup of water free of charge which was nice. However, i usually don't drink tap water from places like diners. I just don't want to risk it. Here it came out in a plastic cup, on a tray with a straw on the tray. I reacted that the straw was not an individually wrapped straw, but a basic straw that just lounged around on the tray. The server picked it up and put it on the table. We all know how we wipe down tables, and I'd rather not put anything that been in direct contact with the table in my mouth.   - I had the jerked chicken and got a plate of flavorful jerked chicken, a cup of rice and bean mix and some salad. The meal was nice and spicy. The chicken was full-on bone-in, something that doesn't bother me - but would been nice to know since that is usually not the way we expect it in these western parts. Again, the meal was good but oh-so frugal and without direct effort.   The meal was good and frugal. Not too much food, and not overpriced. But I have a hard time seeing myself coming back here, due to the Mexican diner feel. It is just not my kind of place. And when I asked how long they had been here, I got the answer '5 years'. In five years this was the culmination of the efforts?! No, I feel not.   I wish this establishment the best of luck, because I really like hard working struggling people that believe in what they do.. but they need to encompass a level of ambiance more than what they have. The austere feeling that fills this establishment is not conducive for their business model. Which is unfortunate.

I drove by last night and noticed the sign and decided I needed to check it out. So I stopped by for a late lunch and was the only one in the place which made for some nice time to chat with the owner and her mother, who was the one whipping up the great food in the kitchen.   They've only been open since February and had relied on fliers and the painted signs on the windows to attract customers. While I was there, supremely enjoying the chicken curry roti, a few other people came in because they drove by and saw the sign.   I couldn't decide between the jerk chicken or the curry for my roti, so I was given samples of both. I thought the jerk chicken was a little too hot for me, but the curry still was able to clear out my sinuses. Wow - slow burn! I was told they could tone down the heat upon request. I'm not sure I'd want to ruin the experience, though.   The menu looked interesting - goat curry, oxtail - along with the jerk and the curry options. I opted for the guava nectar to drink (so yummy!).   This is in my neighborhood so I'll definitely be back to try some more. The atmosphere was comfortable and I was encouraged to linger longer, but I needed to get on with my day. The food and the music piped in made me feel like I took a mini-vacation. Nice.

After reading many reviews I decided to check this restaurant out. I'm not one to write bad reviews but my group and I were not impressed overall. We came for dinner around 7pm. Having been the only individuals there, we had a chance to pick any seat. Ordered the jerk chicken, curry chicken and a shrimp plate. Service was fine but our drinks did not arrive until our food came out which took roughly 35 minutes or so. The rice with my curry shrimp plate was overcooked and hard to bite into with very few shrimp. The curry chicken had too many bones. The jerk chicken was to taste, making it the best of all three orders. Overall, I'm rating 3/5 as I expected faster service; better quality and more food for the money.

My family loves this place! There is something for everyone. With me being vegan, my mom being vegetarian, and my dad and brother being meat eaters, somebody usually compromises when we go out to eat but not at Caribbean Spice. They have nonveg dishes as well as tofu, chickpeas, and mock meat curries. We come here a lot and bring family friends here too. It's one of those places you end up craving randomly after a long day. My favorite order is the Chickpea curry (veggie curry) with roti (no butter, they use oil) instead of rice soooo good! I've also tried the  vegan chicken curry with roti. We usually go in the evening and it takes us a while after ordering to get our food. So if you're dining in go in with plenty of time or call way ahead to pick up your order. I think it takes so long  because they make the food fresh and bring it out. They have slow pace so if you're in a rush may not be the best spot for dinner. The space itself is very small and very low key, casual. It's an open space so you can see everyone (not the kitchen). There is some outdoor seating. Overall love this place and will keep coming back. Thank you for amazing Caribbean food!
Really fresh, healthy and tasty food. Large portions and great choices for vegetarians and vegans. We had vegetarian roti and jerk Tofu. All delicious.

This place has is soo unique and the food is awesome. The inside has cool painting of the areas representing the food. From the inside you are tell this is a small shop, but those are usually the best.   I had the Chicken Roti and it was soo good. It was chicken curry on bread and finished it all. My friend ordered the Jerk Chicken and that was perfect as well.

If you want to go by food only it's a 5/5. However, I have to take it down one for its overtly unprofessional atmosphere. One guy called it "too authentic" and he's kind of right. If you come for lunch, be warned, it's an extremely limited menu. As mentioned in other reviews, the food is slow to come out, but that's because all of it is pretty much cooked to order, so at least it will always taste fresh.  Going back to the atmosphere, like said in other reviews, it looks like a cross between an insurance office and somebody's outdoor patio furniture moved indoors. The restaurant is basically run by a family, so the accents and food are very authentic.  Summary: If you're in the mood for some tasty authentic Caribbean food, look no further. If you want some place efficient or fancy to impress a date, look elsewhere.

I gave this place 1 star only because the food came out pretty quick. However it had no flavor the meat was tough and the potatoes were not cooked all the way.  I ordered the goat curry and I have had some pretty good goat curry in the past and this was NOT good.

The oxtails were excellent they were cooked to perfection and that is from the mouth of the meat eater. Now I had the curry shrimp and it was perfectly spiced and very well cooked. I would recommend this place highly If you have a passion for true Caribbean food.

I had a serious craving for Roti.  So glad I found this place.  A very small menu selection but it had exactly what I wanted.  The serving for $8.20 after tax is enough for 2 meals.  I know where to go from now on for a great meal with leftovers.  This is a noteworthy place to bring my Uncle T.J. who's a Trini when he comes to visit.

If you know West Indian cuisine then you need to come here. Hands-down the best West Indian restaurant in the valley. And trust me I've tried them all. The only complaint I would have is every now and then when I come things and not in stock or available, but they also keep adding things to the menu like soy curry jerk and beans. Can't beat that in the valley.  And for my friend that is so fond of fresh carrot juice, they have fresh carrot/ginger juice on deck!

I love the decor of the place, the lady who owns, but the rice and beans tasted burned. Like the bottom of the pot had burned so they decided to scoop from the top rather than throw all away. I got the curried chicken....which had very good flavor, but I needed the rice and beans to bring it around. The cabbage was tasty.  I'd normally give it a 2 star w the burned beans, but because of  the fine customer service an extra star is warranted. I did call and give them this feedback. Hopefully they will take my feedback to heart and the next customers get great meals!

I was in the mood to get something different so we checked out Yelp reviews to find this Caribbean restaurant. It's definitely a small place but it wasn't busy on the night we went so we put our order in right away. Me and my date both decided on the Jerk Chicken.  We grabbed a table & 2 glasses of water were brought out to us right away; our food came out soon after. At first glance, each plate looked like a really big portion but after eating a few bites we came to realize that it really wasn't that big. The chicken is all served with bones so by the time we got through it, more than half was discarded. It was also a little irksome that the chicken was a bit cold by time it came out.  As far as the taste goes, however, it was spot on. The chicken was really flavored well and the side of rice and beans was tasty as were the warm cabbage and plantains (and I don't even particularly like plantains).  I'd say that for the flavors & all, we will be back. Was it a good deal? Well, no. Not particularly. Was it worth it? Yes, because it was something tasty and different.

This was such a wonderful Caribbean restaurant.  We had the jerk tofu, jerk soy chunks and the curry tofu.  It was all good but I loved the jerk soy chunks!  Now, it is not for the wimpy.  The jerk sauce was hot ... but very flavorful!! The owner was also very delightful!

Wow, things really do change quite a bit in a year and a half!  The service issues are still there but not nearly as bad, oxtail continues to rock my world, goat curry very good, last thing I had here was their escovitch, which was an amazing preparation of fish, it somehow had the sinus-clearing sensation of wasabi with some sour and sweet tones.  Their sides of cabbage, rice, beans, plantains continue to seduce.  Their ginger beer mixed with their sorrell drink just might be my favorite new drink in the last 2 years, its worth a trip just to try it.  4 well deserved star update!
Bad service. I felt uncomfortable, and there were no restrooms to wash up after eating jerk chicken off the bone.
Really great oxtail and fish. They are not overly salty like some other carribean places. Only down side it the wait time for a meal but I guess it's worth the wait in a way.

Welcome to a dinning experience that combines the ambiance of a prison cafeteria with the taste of a Caribbean ghetto. The service was a similar to what one would expect from a DMV employee on their last day with just a hint of that special " I stopped caring a long time ago" attitude that makes their dishes taste all the better. I found the fragrance of body odor that seemed to attach it self the establishment to compliment the slightly sour taste of their food.  If you've every lost hope and gave up dreaming in life, but wanted to do it with a Caribbean flair, then this is the place you should dine. Eat hearty, for you are dining in hell. Prepare your stomach for a meal so bad that a thousand caribbean sunsets could not repair it.   Smooth sailing fellow Yelpers

Read mostly great reviews about this place, even a referral to go there so thought we'd try it out. Could not be more disappointed.   Can only imagine a couple scenarios, we went on an off day, or most of these reviews are good because they've never had authentic food.   As a frequent visitor of the Caribbean, including Trinidad and Tobago, I thought I'd try the roti here. The roti was way too thick, appeared to have no ground up chickpea in it, and overall was just unpleasant. This went for both the chicken and the shrimp variants.  The pholourie here was nothing like the pholourie I've had before. It was dripping with oil, and incredibly soggy. Even the dough it was made from was very different.  No big surprise with the patties here, they are the frozen and reheated ones that I've found everywhere else in the valley, yet somehow this one was inedible, as if it was freezer burned.   I hope this review will make people think twice about blindly going here, if you know what's good, then this place will disappoint. If you don't know any better, give it a try because it only gets better from here.
My favorite place to get comfort food, and great service. This food is the real deal, fast, inexpensive, and delicious!!
I shared two fantastic lunch plates that were flavorful and genuine. This a small, local business offering a glimpse of global cuisine. The setting is casual, eclectic, and comfortable.

This is one of the few times Yelp has let me down. We love Caribbean food and was excited to try this after reading the good reviews.  I would give it zero stars if I could and I rarely feel that way about the restaurants we visit.  We arrived a few minutes before 11am and had to wait outside for it to open. At 11am, the owner opened the doors and let us in. The dining room lights were off and the blinds were closed so she began to open the blinds and turn on the lights. It was very hot in the dining room.  We assumed she had been in the back prepping food for opening but we assumed wrong - more about that later.  Another gentlemen walked in the same time as we did and while we were looking for the menu, he said he wanted a to-go order. He asked for a couple items but was told "we don't have" so he finally settled on jerk chicken.    I went up to order while other half went outside to sit at the table on the patio as it was way too hot to be inside. I too was told on several items that "we are out". I was ready to give up but finally settled on the jerk chicken and the chicken curry.   Now after reading the reviews, we were prepared to wait quite awhile for our food and was surprised when it arrived almost immediately.  The first bite I took of my curry - it was crystal clear that it was leftover as it was cold and the sauce was separating. Since I have no idea how long this leftover had been in the fridge, I opted to not eat it. The plantains were delish and the rice/beans were just okay (not much flavor).  My other half eat his plantains and rice and beans but was avoiding the jerk chicken so I asked him why. He said he didn't want to get food poisoning as we had a 2 hour drive back home! He did take one bite of the jerk chicken and said it was exactly as he thought it would be - reheated slightly, cold, very greasy and slimy on the outside.    Now we know that the owner was not in the back prepping food as she had just arrived minutes before unlocking the door!

Does the change of name to Caribbean Spice indicate that the restaurant is under new management? I sure hope so! This restaurant puts out delicious, authentic Caribbean food that's unlike anything else I've had in the Valley. It's tragic that it's run so poorly.  The first time I came here was with my Puerto Rican dad who owned/managed restaurants for many years. He was surprised how slowly the food came out considering they have small menu with simple fare. He suspected there was a great deal of food prep (chopping onions, parboiling rice) that wasn't being done ahead of time. Nevertheless, we agreed the his jerk chicken and my huge veggie roti was delicious, and he would like to come back to try the oxtail stew.  I returned a second time this week to have dinner with my husband who was coming from work. Anticipating the long wait, I ordered for both of us. I wanted to try the tofu curry this time, but I was told they didn't have any tofu. Really? With a giant Whole Foods down the street, no one could obtain some tofu for dinner service. I got the veggie roti again with the warning that it would take a "loooooooong time" since someone before me just ordered a roti. My husband loved his jerk chicken and the rice and beans on the side. He was also over the moon about the plantains since he is addicted to them. He was surprised how much he liked my veggie roti and ended up eating my leftovers later that night.  We'll be back for the great food, but we'll remember to bring loads of patience.

I am in love with there pasta which the serving is definitely enough for two people. My favorite is the Jerk pasta for sure. My Husband always gets the jerk chicken with white rice and friend plantains. I always get the rum cake because I love sweets and it's quite tasty. I think the thing I like the most though is they deliver. Some times you really don't feel like going out or cooking so they are a life saver.
I love it. Very reasonable for a large amount of food. They even have vegan options. I've been here more than once and will come back. I believe they deliver with grub hub.

I've eaten the jerk chicken here several and promised I wouldn't go back I should've kept my promise to myself. But at least the prior times it taste some what Jerk.This time, the chicken was dry and tasted nothing like jerk sauce. It was more barbecue sauce. I got a beef pattie (we call them enpanadas out east. It was so hard I could hardly chew it. I wanted to go to a real Jamaican restaurant in Central Phx(it's like being on the island), but did not feel like driving that far.  The owners are from Guyana and their style of cuisine is def different than Jamaican. The staff was friendly, but the food....?! Next I get an craving for some real Jerk Chicken I'll wait and go to the Jerk Hut Jamaican Grill. Worth the ride.

I used to frequent this place around 6-7 years ago when frequently in the Tempe area. I remember it being quite good and authentic. I wanted to give a rave review, I did. Alas, I cannot. I walked in to what felt like 100 degrees, the air conditioning was broken. Not to be deterred, I walked up and perused the menu, because it had been over 5 years since I've visited this place.   I asked about the goat. They were out. This, for those unfamiliar with Caribbean restaurants, is a very good sign: good food, and repeat customers who will continue coming and calling to get what they want. I was impressed and so, considering that the quest had been for a goat roti, I ordered a curry chicken roti. If you have excellent curry goat, you will have superb curry chicken. Right?!?    I waited for about 20 minutes, hovering as close to the floor air conditioning unit as possible,  mouth watering in anticipation. I was told it was buss up shot roti but Guyanese style. This seemed promising as I love buss up shot. The roti and chicken came to go. I quickly returned to my hotel, eager to taste. I opened the box to see what appeared to be a larger than average, thicker than average tortilla. Ok, Guyanese style. Then I peeked inside. Oh my. The chicken was WHITE with a thin layer of curry outside. I took a bite because it was too late to change my mind and it's all I have for lunch. Tragic, to say the LEAST. I can only imagine that they we're also out of curry chicken and, in order to not disappoint the pregnant lady, some unseasoned chicken bits were thrown in a pot with water, curry, and potato and boiled on high heat for the 20 minutes I waited. There was no sauce on the curry, it was soooo bland. I've stopped eating after three bites to write this review, which I warn you to take with a bit of salt as I'm not sure my taste buds are properly working. That said, it was horrendously disappointing, all evidence being that the food would be terrific. I would give it another chance, but neither my stomach nor my wallet will permit another go round this trip. I have it a 3 only because the sweet cook who does her best and the service was fine. Good luck.

Chciken curry with roti. The best I have tried for a while. If you can handle spice, ask them to make it spicy. It's definitely worth the money. Very flavorful.    Jerk chicken is also good if you want some side of rice.

This is a good place for South America spices! I was here a few times and tried out some spicy dishes and liked a lot, they also have very nice customer services, plus some very nice smiles waitresses! I loved it here and definitely will be back here for more spices! I highly recommended!

Very disappointed in the food. If you order chicken it's basically just bones. Shrimp? Well baby shrimp is what you get. You like rice and beans? Me too. But not from here. Very bland. A jamacian patty.. one of my favorite things.... well not this one. They are the frozen kind . No, I won't be ordering from here again.

Having tried the great food offered at Hot Pot, I decided to give this restaurant a try. I arrived for lunch on a saturday and was fortunate to be the only and maybe first customer for the day so I was able to actually chit-chat with the owner and meet her mother. This was definitely not a Jamaican restaurant and the big mural of Guyana, painted by a sister as well as the menu reflected the name of the restaurant. Beside the usual fare, there was roti and even a rice-bowl which probably alluded to size and nothing asian. My food was brought out by Salvador, the chilango chef who has obviously been trained by the owner's mom. I ordered the Ox-tail as well as the Brown Stew Chicken, both both rice & peas. I decided to get an order of curried goat as well as jerk chicken to go. The portions were impressive and I was already warned that the rice & peas varied according to the peas/beans they chose to use on a particular day. Today....it was great. The ox-tail was good although not as impressive as Hot Pot.  As for the brown stew chicken...well...that's always a staple on jamaican/caribbean menus and I have always avoided ordering it, just because there is nothing in the name that suggests anything exotic or special. I left, still wondering "What is Brown Stew Chicken?". Don't get me wrong, there was nothing wrong with the meal. It tasted decent, like chicken should; served in a gravy/sauce which is probably the "stewed"  part of the name, and since I don't really have any references to compare it to,  suffice it to say, I would be comfortable whipping it up on my won after following any online recipe. Both meals were served with steamed & seasoned cabbage which was delicious. I have yet to try the other 2 dishes I purchased which I will eat later today. I was told that they will prepare jerk pork and the guyanese speciality, "Pepperpot" if given sufficient notice. I am looking forward to trying both.  Overall, I enjoyed my meals and plan on returning to sample all the items on the menu.

The peas and rice that they make here is GREAT. It makes up for the "Jerk Tofu" which I am afraid to say is not authentic at all, i never saw it before I came here. The place was clean and not crowded feeling. Prices are right on! the Jerk Chicken and plantains are good. They do a good job with this sides. The spice is very well done too. It did seem a bit unorganized, which could make for slow service. On this visit the service was good. This is probably the best value for Caribe' grub around. Many Caribe' places here have high prices and have their nose in the air a bit. This place keeps it real!

To start, let me just say Tempe is not a food haven.  I don't think this area around Phoenix is one in general.  Therefore you shouldn't have too much expectation out of this.  Sure it has a decent share of Greek/Mediterranean joints, but to see a Caribbean place here.....my head told me it could have been really bad or really good.  Thankfully, some yelp reviews leaned me towards the good side, and with the limited options around, how could I go wrong?  So I took a 10 min walk over from the Embassy Suites and got an order to go.  The moment I walked in, I noticed people weren't kidding.....theres a strange arrangement of jewelry displayed and a bunch of empty tables.  I wasn't sure I was even in the right place.  And then the nice old lady looked up to me and asked what I'd like.  That's when I realized I was in the right place.  For a second, I thought they were closed, but I took a few moments to look at the menu (as if I hadn't already studied the reviews on yelp prior), and made a gesture to get the ox tail.  Jerk chicken was close in the race, but something told me I wanted the good stuff...something to erase my experience with Garcias the night before.    The family running the business was really nice and the old lady was really sweet.  We chatted a bit while I waited for the food and before I knew it, I was on my way storming home to devour my meal.  The ox tail was really nicely flavored and stewed perfectly.  I'm not sure if they had a pot of it going, or it got taken out of the fridge and reheated, but in any case, it tasted good.  The rice and beans were complimenting and wasn't too greasy as I was worried it would be.  The collard greens came in what almost tasted like gravy but it worked really well and tasted delicious.  Plantains.....I think were my fault since they probably got too soggy from sitting in the to go box for 10 mins.    But its nice to try something somewhat different in a strange little town here in Tempe.  And its great to know that Taste of the Caribbean did just that.

I saw a Groupon which inspired us to try something new and fun. We ordered the Jerk Chicken and the Curry (Yellow) Chicken... both were pretty good. The curry is make like a thick stew. The Chicken (three pieces) was roasted with a dark brown spice with jerk sauce on top.  Both were served with rice & beans and cabbage with carrots.  The chicken was a little small, since it was priced at $10.  The atmosphere was pleasant - you can sit inside or outdoors. We were at the restaurant on a Saturday night and it appeared that more people were having take out, which allowed us to watch TV for about an hour. As we move into summer and the weather warms, its a great place for "eating on the porch".  Check them out - look for their groupon coupon!

TASTE IS NOT AUTHENTIC .... Did not taste the spices of Caribbean. The oxtail gravy was watery and if I were blindfolded I would think that I was eating any other piece of meat from Golden Corral. I was asked how everything was and I replied honestly that the meat was at least fresh. We had two orders of oxtails. Only came with a cup of rice and peas and a cup of cabbage. We paid extra for plantains. We also ordered two beef patties that tasted as if it was from frozen boxed dough as the edges were too hard to chew. Tasted like boxed beef patties with very little filling. Staff was very polite is why they got one star. Very small portions for a tab of $39.00. I could have seasoned better in my crockpot. We were very disappointed after driving all the way from the Phoenix Univ stadium area.
AWESOME FOOD.. FRIENDLY  lady ,  small little hidden gem but no A/C in the place so if you looking for Restaurant type place . NOPE. But the food is the bomb.

Now THIS is good Caribbean food.  We wandered in a little after noon, and the place was empty... Four tables, and the nice lady who runs the place.  I could tell right away that this was going to be authentic.  I ordered the curry goat, and washed it down with a bottle of Kola Champagne.  It was just like old times, when I was offered curry goat by a Jamaican woman I knew in New York: "Would you like some curry goat?" "I don't particularly care for goat." "Have you had curry goat?" "No." "You're having some curry goat." Yes, curry goat is delicious.  This curry goat definitely met expectations, with a hearty flavor, and very tender.  It had the texture of a good pot roast.  And it had some potatoes mixed in, which taste great when soaked in curry goat juice.  The plate also came with some rice, some of the most delicious plantains I've had, as well as a green salad I could have done without, but ultimately appreciated because I really should eat my vegetables.  No, they're not the fastest place, but it's really like eating home-cooked Caribbean food.  And you don't go eat at someone's house and expect their service to be the most efficient, do you?  The essence of this place was perfectly captured by my coworker, who after I mentioned it might be added to the rotation, said, "F@#k the rotation, I'm eating here every day!"
Retraction. In all fairness, plantains alone do not a 5 star review make. Till I revisit...

I've been eating here for 5 years. At one point I was eating here at least 3 times a week but sadly in the past 3 years the quality of the food has drastically decreased. You could order curry goat Monday and it be AMAZING, you could then order the same entree later on in the week and have super dry goat meat and cold plantains. The quality is not consistent what so ever. I decided to give it another shot today and have just decided to let it go, I highly doubt it will ever be as good as it was 5 years ago. New comers nay love it, only because they didn't know what it used to be...boo hoo

We've eaten here twice and I hope other people will give it a shot. When we eat here we feel as if we've been invited over to someone's house for dinner. The proprietor goes out of her way to make sure everyone is being looked after and that the food is up to standard. The curries are wonderful and so is the jerk chicken, the goat, all fish and shrimp, the side dishes (including rice, eggplant, roti, plantains).   The food is definitely cooked while you wait, so it takes time, but is definitely worth the wait. The only thing that needs improvement is the tables and chairs. It's a bit like patio furniture in is mismatched. I'm sure this will change with time.

Roti fail! I was so happy to find a restaurant in Phoenix that serves Guyanese curry chicken and roti. I really wanted this place to be good but it was a disappointment all around. They screwed up my to go order and only prepared 1 roti when I asked for 3. After a long wait, I finally got my food and was looking forward to digging in. Unfortunately the roti was so greasy that it was inedible. Curry chicken was bland and the potato was undercooked. What a waste of $25. I won't be back.
Customer service was good and the jerk chicken meal was very flavorful . I'll deff be going back :)

The menu is interesting - kicks right off with Goat Curry - I dare you to try it (i was too chicken, i mean i ordered curry chicken instead). It's colorful and cute.  The food was OK.  I would say that it will get better once they are doing higher volume, it was obviously not prepared immediately before we were served (most of these foods do stew all day anyway in all fairness) but it wasn't served piping hot.   I couldn't tell if the rice was supposed to have a smokey flavor. (probably?)  The plantains were yummy.    I'm really torn on the rating for this one.  The ladies that run the place are charming and they are clearly in startup mode.  I WANT to be a huge fan of this place, but not yet.   But if it's near your hood definitely check it out! I couldn't help constantly comparing it in my mind to Havana Cafe-and I think for the price and overall experience and exquisite flavors they've got em beat right now.  3 1/2 stars if there was that rating.

I decided to try the Jerk Wings and oh. my. gosh. Probably some of the best wings I've ever had. The meat was very flavorful, the sauce was incredible, and I had asked for ranch but they suggested I eat it without so I could enjoy the unique flavor. They were right and I loved the suggestion. I will definitely be eating there again and trying more of their menu!

I tried the vegetable curry and it is delicious...lots of flavor which is sometimes hard to find with vegetarian food. My friend had the chicken ROTI which he said was equally delicious. I tried some of the bread from his so I can say it was also good!  This is a small place, pretty simple but nice and clean. The environment isn't anything exciting but the food was amazing and I'm all about the food!

We have dined here twice now and we loved it both times. Yes they have some bugs to work out but the food is great. The owner is very nice and is very interested in making sure your happy with your meal.  Interesting menu and modestly priced. I can assure you we will be back for sure.

Caribbean Spice has some good bones and has the potential of being a real gem- after they've been nominated to Restaurant Impossible or Restaurant Takeover.   I truly want to like this place more but I do have a few concerns like er....where are the restrooms? Generally speaking this place has a very ratty feel (no this is not representative of the Caribbean!!! ), and it would be nice if some more thought was put into the layout and decor.   Since this is one of the very few caribbean places in the area that 1) isn't Jamaican and 2) offer roti on the menu, every time I've dined here I have had the roti  . Some days the flavor of the curry is spot on while other days it can be a little salty. The roti skin is tasty and soft although a little more on the doughy side than I would like.   Takeaway:  If you eat here your experience may be a hit or it may be a miss. You just never know.

I've never eaten Caribbean food in my life. I got the shrimp Roti as I only eat fish. The wait was long, I will say that, but totally worth it. The "flat bread" is the most delicious soft pastry/tortilla like bread I've ever had. I frequent Mediterranean food most and this "flat bread" was better than any fresh made pita I've ever had.    The potatoes inside fell apart at the puncture of my fork. The shrimp was tasty and not over cooked what so ever. The onions and spices were prepared to perfection and the service was kind and attentive.   The only downside from the wait is that this little nook is HOT on the inside. It was warmer in the restaurant than it was outside, which I see being a huge problem for the summer.   To be honest, even if that place gets hot as hell I'd wait long again. So delicious!
Caribbean spice is great. If you like truly authentic jerk chicken dishes, this is for you! I highly recommend their Roti dishes!!

I had never tried Caribbean food and was very curious to try it. My fiance and I went in on a Saturday night and the place was pretty empty. The inside of the restaurant was nice but I found the music too loud and it started to give me a headache. When we walked in, I think it was the chef, just stood there and stared at us without asking us if we wanted a table or not, until I asked if they were open. He then said they were and led us to a table, not too friendly but oh well, maybe he had a bad day. Anyway we were seated at a booth and the menu had some tasty sounding options. We decided to try the Jerk Chicken and it came with rice and you could pick accompanying sides. I believe it was $10 for the chicken and rice and you paid extra for the side(I could be wrong though). The lady working there wasn't very friendly, didn't smile, she took our orders and we didn't wait too long for our food. I ordered the Jerk chicken with rice and a side of fried plantains and my fiance ordered rice and jerk chicken with a side of fries. Our food came but my order was wrong instead of the fried plantains I got a salad. I told the lady about it and she got me my order of plantains without a problem and said I wouldn't be charged for the salad (which since I didn't order was only proper).  My problem was more with the portions than anything else, it was about six or seven sliced plantains for $2.50, thats maybe half a plantain. Bit overpriced for an ingredient that isn't expensive. The jerk chicken was alright, it needed some sort of acidity and maybe something sweet to brighten it but it was not bad. The chicken itself was not cleaned properly and much too fatty for me and it was on the bone. So overall the amount of chicken you paid for was maybe a 1/8 of a cup of chicken.  The saving grace were those plantains , the flavor was delicious but not worth the price.
Great food! As a Puerto Rican I love my caribbean food and far from home this place is awesome. I recommend the Curry Goat is delicious :-)

very friendly wait staff... the jerk chicken salad was fabulous beef patties sucked really bummer because that is my go to appetizer at carribean food spots all in all worth a stop through if you want carribean food in tempe I'm sure the other items are great

The food is INCREDIBLE!!!!!  The girl at the counter was very nice and very helpful, however the food took forever and the place was quite uncomfortable.  I would definitely recommend eating there, just make sure you are not in a hurry.

The food is outstanding.  Just delicious.  And there are a ton of vegan options (which is nice for me).  The food's actually so good that it makes up for the many, many problems the restaurant has: slow service, mixed up orders, sticky tables, slow water refills, poor air conditioning, etc.   I suggest getting carry-out.  And even then, give them an extra 15-20 minutes on top of however long they say it will take.

This is probably the worst Caribbean food I've ever had. I ordered the oxtail and the jerk tofu. The jerk tofu tasted like stew chicken with no seasoning. The veggies were bland, I didn't even taste pepper on them. The oxtail was absolutely trash. To top it off the wait was really long. If you enjoy Jamaican food stay away from this place!!!

I've eaten here before, and the food is usually on point, but tonight they are definitely off their game. I ordered a small Jerk Chicken meal, it came with rice and peas and cabbage. The rice and peas and cabbage was okay, although not very well seasoned; it was passable.  The Jerk Chicken, however was utterly disgusting. It wasn't "jerked" very well. Let me preface this by saying, I know what Jerk Chicken is supposed to taste like, I grew up in Fl w/ family and friends from Jamaica.... The chicken tasted completely off, instead of the usual yummy blend of herbs and spices of jerk seasoning, it tasted like some sort of "sweet," nutmeg-heavy barbecue sauce. I knew it wasn't going to be right to begin with, because it looked like it had a dark, wet, gross-looking glaze, and sure enough it tasted horrible.  The price of the small meal was fair, it came with a generous helping of rice and pease and a smattering of cabbage.  I tried the Jamaican Pineapple Ginger drink, and it was good, although not good enough to justify the $3.50 price.  I was totally surprised by the awful tasting jerk chicken at Caribbean Spice, as I said, I had eaten here before and my meal was delicious. I truly hope this isn't the new trend here.
Love this place, usually get the jerk or curry chicken.. roti is really good as well.. the jerk wings are bomb too!

This is my first time visiting Caribbean spice. I am from the Caribbean and had a taste for Roti. I was disappointed with the Roti. The flavor was mediocre i.e. Not spicy. It was salty and was not wrapped the traditional style. I did not enjoy it. I also ordered ginger beer. It was brown in color and had too much spice in it. It did not taste like ginger beer. My worst tasting homemade ginger beer ever. I was disappointed. My husband threw his away and I added water to mine and could not finish it. Your beef pie was just okay. This might be good for people who are not familiar however for people from the islands they know the difference. Needless to say I will not visit this restaurant again when I am in Phoenix. You definitely need to Make positive changes to stay in business.

Had the goat curry.  Came with some red beans and rice, plantains, and cabbage. Was very good.  Had a lot of tiny bones in it so watch out for that.  Dad had the jerk fish.  Great flavor and they don't hold back the spice.   A bit pricey and the service was a bit awkward.  Will go again.  Going to try the chicken next.

Never ever again. I ordered curry chicken with rice and peas and patty....the food lacked flavor. Im from brooklyn in crowns heights which has huge west indian community and has west indian restaurants all over...so i feel the food lacked authenticity and the beef patty was stale and the spanish guy in the back heated in the microwave. Also i tried to make light convo with a woman who.i presume was the owner and her friend who was watching television they were both cold.

Time to update my take on this family run Caribbean food restaurant. Today I had the lunch jerk chicken ($6.99). It comes with beans and rice, fried plantains and a cabbage/carrot side dish. Everything was excellent. My daughter had the dinner sized oxtails ($13.99) and stated that it was delish. She had enough left over to take home for dinner.   I have had the goat curry (no longer available in the lunch size, just the large dinner size), the jerk chicken, and the oxtail. All have had great flavors, but watch out for small bones. We were too full to sample the deserts today.  The dining area is small, so not ideal for large groups. I noted that they now do catering. There are a few table and chairs on the porch just outside of the entry door. Parking is close to the door. I do recommend this local establishment.

Upon entering the location I was a bit worried about what my buddy was thinking coming here. However, meeting everyone that works here and owns the place, it is awesome. I ordered the chicken curry along with the goat curry and Roti. If I could have licked the plate I would have. It was fantastic. The dirty rice that came with my meals were perfectly done. And the flavors were out of this world. It was not spicey at all as I think they saw me and assumed I couldn't handle spicey. Next time I will be requesting the food to be spicier. Overall, another fantastic small business restaurant to try when in Tempe!
Been here twice, I enjoy the food. They're a very traditional family so don't expect the American greeting

I've been going to this place a few years now . I'm almost sure they must have a new cook , new management or something . Had the jerk chicken and it taste more like barbecue chicken . Wasn't awful just wasn't what I expected . I will not be going back here anymore . Just don't seem the same .

Unusual for us to end up in this area, but we were and we were hungry.  I spotted this on Yelp, and noted generally good reviews.  So we drove over.  When we entered the place looked kinda divey.  But the smells were good!   The host was friendly and helpful.  We almost went for a roti, but it's hard for me to judge a place based on a dish I've never had.  So we got a curry chicken and a jerk chicken.  Then we opted to sit at an outside table.  We also ordered a fruit smoothy (mango and banana, I think).  While I didn't order one, I noted several unique sodas were available too..  The food was VERY good.  The curry was a yellow curry, and very nice.  It was mostly chicken and potatoes (I like carrots in my yellow curry also, but that's minor).  The jerk chicken was very well done.  Strong jerk flavor with just a bit of heat (note that my idea of "hot" is hotter than the average person, but I'm still a wimp compared to a Thai person).  Both dishes were served with a rice/bean combo (i.e. not rice AND beans, but rice&beans).  It was very good too.  The mango cheesecake was excellent.  All in all, a great meal.
